PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: UFAL - Framework For Building Interactive Learning Environments

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Bittencourt, Ig Ibert;BITTENCOURT, IG IBERT;BITTENCOURT, IG, I.;BITTENCOURT, IG I.;IBERT BITTENCOURT, IG;I. BITTENCOURT, IG;BITTENCOURT, IG

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Intelligent Tutoring Systems (ITS) are inherently complex, domain-oriented software systems which are frequently pointed out by researchers as suitable applications for the multi-agent approach. Developing and maintaining Multi-agent ITS are a hard task since it involves different stakeholders, with different expert and roles, such as developers, for developing new software features; domain experts, for managing ITS knowledge domain; authors, for customizing ITS execution for a given context; and users, which are not aware about ITS complexity and require a friendly user interface to interact with the system. Some works have been proposed to support the development of ITS, but they do not consider the stakeholders involved in the whole development and maintenance processes. In this project we present a software framework for designing, developing, and maintenance of Multi-agent ITS. This framework aims to be useful to ITS developers, domain experts, authors and users, providing a different view for each stakeholder, with different tools to support their activities. The focus here is more on developers and describe the framework architecture, design, and extension points, detailing how to customize them for specific domains.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Programa CAPES-PROBRAL - BlogSpread: Perceiving the meme phenomenom by visualising the blogsphere semantically

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Bittencourt, Ig Ibert;BITTENCOURT, IG IBERT;BITTENCOURT, IG, I.;BITTENCOURT, IG I.;IBERT BITTENCOURT, IG;I. BITTENCOURT, IG;BITTENCOURT, IG

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main goal of this project is to investigate and to demonstrate the hypothesis that the integration of the Information retrieval field, Information extraction field, ontology creation and 3D visualization can solve the problem in displaying a complete global view of large information spaces in a limited screen, and the problem of searching and navigating through such large global views to find particular and relevant data items in meme dissemination. The specifics goals are: Given a set of terms, retrieval of relevant blogs post from blogosphere. Extraction of relevant attributes or metrics from unstructured data sets (Blog corpus). To develop sentimental analysis of these blog corpus and classify according to sentiment (Human feelings). To develop a Blog Ontology. To develop a Meme Transmission Path and a social network graph (taking on consideration the new FOAF format). To propose a new visualization scheme for navigating through the data. Exploring visualization techniques such as: overview, zoom, filtering, details on demand, relate, and history. To design and to implement a GUI prototype based on 3D visualization for this blogosphere. To create a user-experience design methodology (HCI) for 3D visualization. To investigate and to validate if the use of the graphical metaphor for interacting with computer can help to make visualization ubiquitous and to help people gain insights from large-scale collections of unstructured corpus for the study of meme dispersion.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Education is a major player in a society. Distance learning is currently a very important topic world-wide (with the rise of MOOCs e.g. Corsera in the US and FutureLearn in Europe) as well as in Brazil. In particular, access to higher education, which is lagging behind in Brazil, compared to the UK or other developed countries, needs supported. (Valor aprox. R$ 40.000,00).

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Bittencourt, Ig Ibert;BITTENCOURT, IG IBERT;BITTENCOURT, IG, I.;BITTENCOURT, IG I.;IBERT BITTENCOURT, IG;I. BITTENCOURT, IG;BITTENCOURT, IG

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Call Researcher Links/British Council - Newton Fund/CONFAP - FAPEAL - Higher Education For All
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Economic development depends on highly skilled, educated individuals. Lower education level is linked to low income, poverty. In the UK, Higher Education is available to many high school graduates (~50% in 2011-12; The Guardian). In Brazil, numbers are much lower (< 20%; OECD). Pioneering efforts from academia & companies (incl. proposers) to support pupils from impoverished, underprivileged backgrounds to enter universities (to pass the intensive public exam ' ENEM'), are e-learning solutions. Still, initial data show typical distance learning problems: isolation, lack of customisation. The workshop invites UK, Brazil & international researchers towards solving the urgent, timely problem of access for children from impoverished backgrounds, via new, seamless personalisation, gamification, semantic & social interaction techniques for specific needs of the millions of candidates, based on (big) data analysis, user analytics, scalability. It dedicatedly promotes equal opportunities.
The workshop's main aim is to bring together researchers, practitioners, other stakeholders working or interested in the fields of educational technology, semantic web, Web 2.0, adaptivity, big data, learner analytics, NLP. We expect to discuss the merger of research and application directions, see their implementations and evaluations, encourage the transition towards concrete, large scale applications - such as in the Brazilian entrance to higher education field. Participants are expected to leave with a better knowledge of current research, to have fruitful brainstorming sessions, generate new ideas and new paths. Discussions results will be posted after the workshop on-line, as in previous workshops, and a special issue in a quality journal will be proposed (Valor aprox. R$ 170.000,00)
